root_cause_analysis.primary_issue: RSMS v2.0 schema mismatch with resource sheet frontmatter structure
details: Resource sheets include fields: workorder_id, feature_id, phase, complexity, dependencies, related_sheets, created, updated, loc
RSMS v2.0 schema only allows: subject, parent_project, category, version, status, related_files, related_docs, tags
Additional properties are explicitly disallowed by schema (additionalProperties: false)
This represents a fundamental mismatch between documentation practice and schema definition
secondary_issues: File location validator expects flat 'coderef/resources-sheets/' but project uses subdirectories (components/, utilities/)
Filename format validator expects hyphenated PascalCase but project uses camelCase/PascalCase without hyphens
Status field uses 'active' but schema only allows DRAFT/REVIEW/APPROVED/ARCHIVED

recommendations: CRITICAL: Resolve RSMS v2.0 schema vs practice mismatch - either:
Option A: Update RSMS v2.0 schema to allow additional fields (workorder_id, feature_id, phase, etc.)
Option B: Remove all additional fields from resource sheet frontmatter (breaks traceability)
Option C: Create extended schema variant for workorder-tracked resource sheets
BLOCKING: Fix CLAUDE.md frontmatter (Phase 1 regression - critical UDS violation)
MAJOR: Standardize file location expectations (allow subdirectories or flatten structure)
MAJOR: Standardize filename conventions (hyphens vs no hyphens)
MAJOR: Standardize status enum values
RECOMMENDED: Add all missing recommended sections (Audience & Intent, Quick Reference, Usage)

blocking_issues: CRITICAL: CLAUDE.md missing YAML frontmatter (Phase 1 regression)
MAJOR: 24 schema validation errors across 7 documents
MAJOR: RSMS v2.0 schema fundamentally incompatible with current resource sheet practice

next_steps: 1. URGENT: Address RSMS v2.0 schema mismatch (ecosystem-wide issue affecting all resource sheets)
3. Decide on file organization standard (subdirectories vs flat structure)
4. Decide on filename convention (hyphens required or optional)
5. Update all resource sheets to match finalized standards

impact_assessment.recommended_approach: Schema extension (Option C) - preserves traceability, minimal doc changes
